dct_description_sm: Issued in his: Geography rectified: or, a Description of the World ... Printed for Robert Morden and Thomas Cockeril ..., London, 1680. Reissued many times. Apparently issued in: Atlas terrestris: or a book of mapps of ... the whole world / John Seller, London, [1700]. Issued in: Geography anatomiz'd / Patrick Gordon, London, 1702 and subsequent editions until 1722.

With latitude markings along bottom border in 10 degree units west to east from 180 degrees to 10 degrees. With “(361)” (page top center) and “Qqq 3” (bottom center); and with heading below map “AMERICA” and text catchwords: “...Ages: | This”. Issued in his: Geography rectified: or, a Description of the World ..., 1680.

With longitude markings along bottom border west to east from 198 or 368 [sic] degrees. With “512” and “T”, and with heading below map “AMERICA” and text catchwords: “... by considering | the”. Issued in his: Geography rectified: or, a Description of the World ..., 1688.

With “Page 62”(top left) and with longitude markings along bottom border west to east from 198 or 368 [sic] degrees. Apparently printed both with text on the page and alone. Issued in his: Geography rectified: or, a Description of the World ..., 1693. Issued in: A Geographical dictionary; representing the present and ancient names of all the countries, provinces, remarkable cities, universities, ports, towns, mountains, seas, streights, fountains, and rivers of the whole World ... , Second edition ... together with several useful maps not in the former Edition, opposite p. [33] / by Edmund Bohun. -- London : Printed for Charles Brome, at the Gun, at the West-End of S. Pauls, 1691. (Checklist maps #97 and 98 are not included.)

With "Page. 333" (top left) and with longitude markings along bottom border west to east from 198 or 368 [sic] degrees. With “542” (page top left) and “AMERICA” (top center) and text below map with catchwords: “... by considering | the”. Issued in his: Geography rectified: or, a Description of the World ..., 1700.

State 4, Variant With "Page. 333" (top left) and with longitude markings along bottom border west to east from 198 or 368 [sic] degrees. Without text on page. Reissued without text on page in: Geography Anatomiz’d ... / Patrick Gordon. -- Printed for Robert Morden, Thomas Cockerill and Ralph Smith ..., London, 1702.
With “Page. 103” (top left). Issued in his: [Atlas without Title-page, London, c.1702].
Barbara McCorkle; AshleyBaynton-Williams; Faupel’s Catalog 106(126); David M. Rumsey.
California of Sanson's second model and with only P. Sr. F. Drake named. Title and cartographer’s name without cartouche (top left).
